string.text: Document
Major's PDA

A message was found on this PDA for someone named Major:\nR-138, we've got a new job - it comes from our friends at Bloodcall, over by the Anthill. It's a big one. Rumor has it there’s a Frankenstein stalker wandering the Zone - literally pieced together by the Doctor from parts of other stalkers. We can’t get to the Doctor’s hut in the Swamps; the psionic activity there is off the charts. But the creation is still out there, somewhere in the Zone. Your task is to find him and bring him to the Perimeter—alive, if possible. I’ve already passed his description to my men, but you’ve got a better shot at tracking him down. Send me your account number - I’ll pay in advance if you're taking the job.
Ordinance 563

A large pile of papers with various entries...
In order to ensure greater safety and stability of research operations (following several unfortunate incidents), it was decided to implement a third tier of psionic-treatment for all laboratory personnel - from janitors to lead scientists. Everyone will be equipped with adaptive psionic-blockers designed to prevent disruptions, riots, data theft, and escape attempts.
Message:
...there was a conflict between a group of scientists developing psychotropic weapons and the leadership of Project Cover. The scientists objected to being subjected to the very weapons they were creating. Realizing that psionic exposure was only a matter of time, they began to quietly plan a way to protect themselves - and perhaps escape their fate.

Test results of the Posthuman Project.\nIn the document folder, there is a sheet titled "Conclusion." Based on the results, the following points have been determined: 1) The project remains far from completion, 2) efforts should be redirected toward developing a method that both enhances the cognitive function of the test subjects and effectively maximizes radiation output from the outer cortex, 3) the Neuroengineering Department must be brought in to consult on managing psi overload.
Card
An access card that's meant for controlling the main module of the transmitter.
Memo

The development of psychotronic weapons initiated in the USSR eventually led to the launch of the C-Consciousness Project in 2006, with its laboratories located within the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant.
The project's core idea was to influence the Earth's information field—the "noosphere" - believed to be the layer through which the human mind could be affected on a global scale. A group of scientists, driven by supposedly humanitarian motives - though not without the self-serving interests of the planet’s so-called gray cardinals - activated the generators and began an experiment intended to halt violence, war, crime, and other forms of suffering. However, this idealistic endeavor disrupted something fundamental in the fabric of reality. As a result, nature and its inhabitants began to mutate within the localized area now known as the Zone. Realizing that events had spiraled out of control, yet also understanding that they alone were responsible for fixing it, the experiment’s participants sealed off the Center of the Zone with powerful psionic-fields. To further deter outsiders, they created the myth of the Wish Granter, supposedly hidden beneath the Chernobyl sarcophagus - but in truth, it was a "Monolith" psionic-emitter, triggering intense hallucinogenic visions that simulate the fulfillment of an individual’s deepest desires.\The C-Consciousness group also began using psionic-influence on global leaders to prevent large-scale military incursions into the Zone, fearing such action would destroy the generators - humanity’s last hope of restoring balance. Simultaneously, they pressured governments to restrict civilian access to the Zone through military cordons and stalker patrols.
Squads were formed from zombified individuals or memory-wiped agents - people who had reached the Zone’s center and fallen under Monolith’s control. These agents were either extracted from the Zone or dispatched to eliminate unwanted individuals, both inside and outside the Zone. This entire zombification and control protocol was codenamed S.T.A.L.K.E.R.
Gunslinger is one of these agents. He had uncovered too much to be allowed to live. Yet, as with any complex system, errors occur—instead of being terminated, he was zombified and assigned to eliminate himself. It is only thanks to his rare resilience to psionic-influence that he remains conscious—and dangerous.
Prototype T-ZUD-12
This device is an experimental prototype of T-ZUD-12. It's defective, but it may be worth something.
Psi-blocker
A device that protects its user against the effects of a blowout on the body. Its effectiveness is limited.
Psi-energy meter

A piece of specialized equipment designed to measure the energy properties of a blowout. Scientists have observed unusual activity in the Zone during these events and are determined to uncover the nature of these phenomena. To collect accurate data, the device must be placed in an open area during the intermediate phase of a blowout.
Prison superintendent's log
A logbook belonging to the prison superintendent. It contains records suggesting that materials were being supplied to the workshops at the Rostok factory for unknown purposes.
Notes on experiments

Psychotropic antenna information: 1. Whoever controls it can control zombies, rats, and blind dogs - directing them to attack specific targets. It strongly affects flesh, corpses, humans, dwarves, and pseudo-humans. 2. With the help of the psychotropic antenna, it is possible to disrupt peace among stalkers - causing widespread mistrust and paranoia. 3. The antenna can induce mass hysteria and sow discord between stalkers. 4. Effects of psycho-emotional correction on AU settlement workers include: increased productivity, efficiency, and stamina; heightened attention; and reduced emotional tension. Reported observations of long-term residents in areas with background radiation levels inconsistent with established norms include: statistical anomalies in psychic sensitivity fluctuations during prolonged exposure; genetic mutations; and emergence of recessive traits.

The scout team advanced into the anomaly field, searching for a safe route to the northern sector of the power plant. The Geiger counter was already maxed out at this distance from the Sarcophagus - I had to switch it off just to keep it from being a constant distraction. The colonel gave a brief rundown of our mission: under cover from a sniper team, we would infiltrate the Sarcophagus from the north side of the plant, then move through the turbine hall to the reactor chamber - where, according to instrument readings, the Black Monolith is located. Our job was to take all necessary measurements around it: anomaly activity, energy output in gigawatts, and levels of psionic radiation. After that, the military would handle the Black Monolith. I just had to finish before the blowout began...
Report note

A report outlining the urgent need to install and activate experimental equipment. Notably, it mentions a conflict between a group of scientists working on psychotropic weapons and the leadership of Project Cover. The scientists were unwilling to be subjected to the very weapons they were developing. Aware that exposure to dangerous levels of psionic radiation was only a matter of time, they began to reassess their situation and devised a plan to protect themselves from danger.
Order

This document contains an order to install and activate equipment in the Pripyat area. There's also a note indicating a downtime window for the installation - from 21:00 to 23:00. The rest of the text is illegible.
Journalist's diary

1. Gunslinger informed me that he no longer trusts the scientists at Lake Yantar. After his trip to the Center, something changed in him. He spoke of strange things happening there. He asked me to come with him next time. I agreed - after his injury, he needs someone watching his back. But first, we have to head to the Dark Valley. The snitch contacted us and said there’s something there that might interest us. 2. Returned from the raid in the Valley. I could smell it was a trap - the military was waiting for us right at the complex exit. Had to take them all out. If it hadn’t been for Gunslinger, I wouldn’t have made it out alive. But we found what we came for. Turns out an international research center was conducting genetic experiments there. We looked for any info on the Black Monolith, but came up empty. We’ll have to check with the eggheads at Yantar - maybe they know something. From here, we head north. I think I’m becoming more like Gunslinger. I don’t trust anyone now. Just him and the Mediator. No one else.

Took the Mediator's container. He... wouldn’t hand it over willingly, so I had to do it the hard way. I took care of him, but now I can’t open the damn thing - it’s locked with a code. Should’ve gotten it from him before I put him down. Gotta head back to our rendezvous point. If I can open it… I’ll be cured.
Note from Hmir to Sana Borov
Note from Hmir to the Mediator

Mediator, I'm looking for the Journalist. I have what he’s after. Word is, you know how to find him. Meet me at near the Bar - at a house on the south side, across from the school. Come alone. - Messer

Most of the information is encrypted. Only the professor’s final message is readable: "The lab has access to the lower levels of the Cordon, but the entrance is reportedly locked from the inside. If possible, verify this after completing the measurements."

A Personal Digital Assistant, with its recent messages still intact. One of the last entries is from the host of the "Stalker" Bar: "He's heading north. Last seen at the Garbage. Follow him until he reaches the center. Don't go into Pripyat - it's a dead end. If he enters the city, turn back - the military will take care of him."
Blue 9's PDA
An encrypted PDA that belonged to a military stalker with the callsign Blue 9. Perhaps someone with the right skills can decrypt it and uncover its contents.

Subject has detected Passage 1 and 3, proceeding to Sector 28.
Teams White and Green: proceed to Sector 26 for evacuation.
Red Groups: remain in the Dark Valley near the laboratory sector, at the exit leading to the Cordon catacombs.
Blue Groups: three samples of anomalous formation #24 have been discovered in the Cordon - near the factory entrance, the water tower, and the ruined building in the village.
All units: a backup weapons cache is located in the Radar area; coordinates are attached to this message. Use only if absolutely necessary.
Contact Major regarding the facility.
Note from Production Manager

Note in margin: Hand delivered personally.\nAs per your order, a shipment of gas masks and work clothing has been transferred to the lower levels of the workshops - 140 units in total, along with several boxes of special cargo intended for your operations. We’ve established one access route from the plant to your sector, and I have the entry code to the anteroom: 2565, just a reminder. We have no access beyond that point. We’re not asking too many questions, but still - Mr. Petrov, why are vehicles arriving? They’re coming from the city, passing beneath the lake, and heading straight to your location. Don’t get me wrong - we’re not looking to interfere - but I’d rather not risk my position over unexplained activity. I hope we can meet in person soon to discuss this in more detail.
Unknown device
A device of some kind. Its function is unknown.
Gravity hammer
A gravity hammer created by Burers, powered by anomalous energy.

We've instructed our two teams to split up. The complete artifact must not be allowed to reach the mainland. An anomalous concentration point has been identified near Unit 1 (Woodpecker 1), close to an abandoned railroad tunnel - avoid that area. It’s been sealed off by the previous group, but steer clear regardless. Once both teams have destroyed the remaining parts of the artifact, we’ll regroup behind the roadblock...
Skull
A human skull made of a strange, unnatural material. It moves slightly when touched, and there appear to be some kind of mounts or fittings embedded in the eye sockets.
Scanner
An experimental prototype designed to scan psionic radiation. To operate, simply point the device at the target object and activate it.
Journalist's note

Damn. I shouldn't have gotten myself into this mess. The Winds of Madness must definitely be around here somewhere...
I shouldn't have gone straight to the base of those lunatics...
jI just need to get out...
Need to catch the time...
Notice the chance...
Access card
A personal access card. In the Zone, these are normally used by scientists to access restricted areas in scientific facilities.
Map
A personal access card for the lower level of the underground facility. The code is 8418.
Psi-Stabilizer
A device that shields its user from certain types of psionic attacks, including those from Controllers, and also offers protection against the harmful effects of "ghost" psionic formations.
Analyzer
An air analyzer specifically calibrated to detect and analyze parasite spores. To activate it, place the device near the source of the spores.
Brain Link documentation

...The four primary subjects remain in a state of induced coma, and if I’m not mistaken, they’re the ones controlling everything that happens in the Zone...\nNote: Gunslinger knew the code to the lab - it might still be hidden in the stash at Rostok...
Psi-Stabilizer documentation

A thick folder, surprisingly well-preserved, with all pages still intact. The title page reads: "Documentation for the Psi-Stabilizer" and bears the official state seal. Inside, the pages are filled with neat pencil notes, where the author repeatedly recommends reducing the main unit’s power consumption - arguing that doing so would improve the mobility of the protective device. Attached to the final page are two envelopes containing letters addressed to the head of scientific laboratory ZX-16. In the first, the sender requests a field test of the psi-defense device, selecting a village on the outskirts of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone as one of the trial sites. The second letter provides a detailed report on the successful outcome of those tests.
Psi-visor documentation

The documentation folder is badly torn, with many pages missing. However, from the few remaining sheets, it’s clear that the contents describe the functionality of the psi-visor - an experimental next-generation device designed to aid survival in the hazardous environment of the Zone. The psi-visor is used to detect mobile sources of psionic radiation, specifically psionic creatures. Unlike humans, these entities exhibit a unique rhythm of bioelectric brain activity, still not fully understood by modern science. The device scans the surrounding area for these distinct neural patterns and alerts its user to the presence of a psionic lifeform.
Anti-radiation suit documentation

An old folder, covered in dust, holds a collection of yellowed pages containing a schematic of a radiation shielding suit along with detailed usage instructions. According to the documentation, these limited-series suits were delivered to the laboratory ahead of schedule from the Research Institute of Radiation Safety and had not yet undergone all required testing. Noted advantages include a closed breathing system and a next-generation insulating coating capable of partially blocking streams of hot particles. However, the suit also has drawbacks: reduced mobility due to the heavy oxygen cylinders mounted on the back, and low resistance to mechanical damage. An appendix at the end of the folder contains notes on the development of a new version of the anti-radiation suit, designed to address and correct the shortcomings of earlier models.
Visual detector documentation

Documentation for an experimental software system integrated into the PDAs used by expeditionary units of military stalkers. It was discovered near one such unit in the catacombs beneath the Agroprom Research Institute. The devices themselves were shattered beyond repair and hold little value, but the documentation remains intact. According to the files, the system allows its user to scan the surrounding area within a 50-meter radius for the presence of other active devices. It can then read, analyze, and display information about the stalkers carrying them. Based on this data, the software generates a profile indicating the detected stalker’s faction affiliation, reputation within the community, and their estimated attitude toward the user.
Cargo for the Professor
A container that's for the Professor - a special package from a big city.

...the PDA battery's almost dead... I think this is the last note. I don’t know how long I’ve been down here, but I think there’s a way out - because I can hear sounds. It’s like there’s something just beyond the wall. People. Footsteps. Movement. I’ve been shouting, but no one’s heard me yet. Still, I think I can make it out. I heard that guy from the death truck - he was putting something on me. He’s the reason I’m here. When I get out, I’ll tell everyone what he really is. And the General, too. They thought I didn’t know. But I did. The most important thing now is to get out before the food runs out. It’s fine - I’ll tell everyone. Gunslinger was talking to-
The goals of the C-Consciousness Project

Psychotropic Influence and Zombification on a Global Scale:
1. Subtle, invisible influence aimed at shaping general behavior across large populations, particularly in urban centers.
2. Targeted manipulation of underground political groups to destabilize or redirect their activities.
3. Creation of favorable conditions for the official rollout of psi-based influence on a planetary level - intended to alter the psyche, mood, and mental state of entire nations.
4. Strategic redirection of public attention to suppress awareness of psychotropic research, resulting in an artificial decline of interest in parapsychology.
5. Deployment of psionic "keys" in major cities, capable of converting up to 50% of the population into controllable biorobots.
6. Initial successes in large-scale behavioral manipulation include the mass re-adoption of outdated currency (e.g., Soviet rubles) as a test of state-level influence.
Controllers

Controllers are former humans who have undergone extensive surgical and biochemical modifications to their brains. These changes grant them the ability to control other living beings through microlepton brainwaves - essentially, a form of telepathy. They are typically dressed in tight-fitting, semi-sportive black uniforms. Additionally, there's some important details about controllers that have been documented:
1. Completely mute
2. Capture and zombify stalkers using fragments of their own consciousness
3. Actively prevent researchers from reaching the Zone’s center
4. Control and direct mutant life forms within the Zone
5. Deploy psi-generators to zombify both animals and humans
6. Controllers prefer to work at night, though they remain fully capable during daylight hours. Most major takeovers done by Controllers occur at night
Factions:
Roadblock
7. Most Controllers do not interfere with military stalkers.
Diary

...Beneath the ground lie the bodies of the C-Consciousness, maintained in a near-comatose state. Within the laboratory, one body acts as their physical proxy - controlled directly by the collective. It carries out their will, manages external operations, and ensures their biological needs are met. This figure serves as the primary representative of the C-Consciousness project. The children were "harvested" by C-Consciousness as part of a program to prepare more powerful successors...
A note
I remember everything! Give the Cyclicity Chart of the Winds of Madness to Messer, he has to go!
The documents on the Winds of Madness, annotated with the Professor’s notes/text>

This folder of documents appears to have been partially burned. There are soot marks on the cover, and the corners of the pages are blackened. The sheets detailing experiments conducted in the Zone have been supplemented with the Professor’s notes. On the back of one graph, a handwritten message to Messer appears in the Professor’s own hand.
"Messer, forgive me. I have devoted my whole life to science. I believed in progress and its benefit to mankind. I set great goals for myself, but now I see where my actions have led. I didn't want this. I'm sorry you have to live in this world, but there is nothing I can do to make up for my mistakes. Go to the North, you'll find the answers to all your questions. Thanks to these papers, I was able to calculate the exact cooling time of the machine that keeps the stalkers out of the Center. You can shut it down if you sneak into the maintenance lab when it's not working at full capacity. The cooling phase starts at 21:00 and lasts about two hours. But even at this time the plant is still active, so you can't get close without psionic protection.
I hope I've been of some help. Please don't blame me for what I did. But now I can't live in peace seeing the 'wondrous new' world I had a hand in. Go North, Messer. You must go."
Professor
PDA with the description of a stash
Documentation

An unremarkable folder at first glance—worn from repeated use, as evident from its scuffed cover - but the contents inside tell a different story. Each sheet is laminated and unusually thick, clearly preserved with care. What’s inside is impressive: a detailed assembly manual for a psi helmet. Even a quick look reveals that every page has been meticulously laid out for clarity, aimed at someone with technical expertise. The sketches and attached photographs suggest the device isn’t overly complex to assemble. However, the numerous handwritten notes and appended experimental data indicate that proper calibration requires specialized knowledge in neurobiology and cybernetics, along with access to rare or difficult-to-manufacture components for the helmet to function effectively.
Medical supplies
A crate filled with medical supplies. It has a Duty faction emblem on the side.
Winds of Madness Document

This document folder shows clear signs of having been nearly burned - soot stains cover the outside, and the corners of the pages are blackened. Inside are ten sheets of notes detailing experiments conducted in the Zone. If the leader of Sin locked this folder in a safe, there was a reason. Also included is a draft of a letter addressed to V.M. Chubko:\n"Returned from testing the Kaymanov unit. Not only were the drugs not distributed to everyone, but biological material is wandering the building unguarded. There’s a blatant disregard for safety protocols. His setup is a disaster—wasting enormous amounts of money on equipment and cooling systems. I’ve already started studying their schematics (don’t ask how I got them - you wouldn’t believe me anyway), and I’ll send copies along with this letter for you to see for yourself. The installation requires a nearby nuclear power plant, so forget about any possibility of mobility. And if it overheats, the whole thing will spiral out of control, scrambling everyone's brains indiscriminately. If you want proper security for the Central Lab against outside threats, use our technology instead. Of course, the final decision is yours. If you prefer to keep a volatile emitter at your side, so be it, Vladimir Mikhailovich. But I won't take responsibility for the consequences. Next time, I’ll submit a formal complaint to the Group for review.\nPrikhodko P.S."
Key
The key to the Sin leader's safe.
Protective boots
A pair of protective boots, made out of a special material that can protect against corrosive acids.
Hoplite's PDA
Personal PDA belonging to a stalker known as Hoplite. Access is locked behind a password - perhaps one of the scientists can decrypt it.

I didn’t get a chance to record this the day before yesterday. I ran into Journalist in the nearby swamp - had to carry him back to his hideout and help him get back on his feet. Ended up using the Zuda I’d been saving for Toad, but it was worth it. He said he was running from someone, though when I asked who, he kept quiet. I saw him off today - he headed north. I’m not sure where exactly or why, but it sounded like he was planning to meet with some of his informants. Before leaving, he asked if I’d been to the archives at the local research institute. He was interested in documents related to equipment deliveries to the lab near the Radar sector. I’ll stop by when I’m in the area, and if I find anything, I’ll let him know next time we cross paths.
Scientist's diary

...The experiments on the "Common Consciousness" project were deemed successful. Neural binding of five prisoners produced positive results. The resulting entity, known as "Common Consciousness" or "C-Consciousness," initially displayed slightly less cognitive output than the combined intelligence of five average humans. However, it soon awakened, exhibiting intense neural activity and a data processing speed nearly five times faster than that of a normal human brain. The prisoners’ previously erased memories began to resurface... [no data]. Precautions proved inadequate. The research team was unprepared for what followed. Upon contact with one of the sedated bodies from the C-Consciousness group, two technicians and a nurse were immediately brought under its control. Control of the entire research block was established with alarming speed. In a desperate response, the project leaders isolated the block and released lethal gas through the ventilation system. Twenty-eight controlled bodies convulsed as C-Consciousness frantically attempted to calculate escape routes by scanning the memories of its hosts. Although the bodies began to die, C-Consciousness discovered one-way observation windows - behind which a group of scientists had been monitoring the aftermath. Using intense telepathic influence, it seized control of them as well. From that moment, C-Consciousness could no longer be contained. The remaining staff of the underground complex was assimilated, and the power of the collective consciousness increased tenfold. In total, approximately 500 individuals became connected to C-Consciousness...
Diary

A diary that belonged to a dead stalker. Some of the pages are blurred by decay, but a few entries remain legible.
02.04.2012 ...agreed to join an expedition into the city. Maybe they’ll even issue me a protective suit. Until then, I’ll manage - the jacket I’ve got isn’t bad. Ah, almost forgot - there’s a locked room in the ruins behind a closet... once I’m in the city, I need to check it out. The closet’s tough to move, though.
03.04.2012 Reached the Freedom base. Only Chrome was there, along with a couple of his guys guarding the place. He said the zombies get especially aggressive right before a blowout in the city. Best to hole up an hour or two before it starts. I’ll keep that in mind.
02.04.2012, 23:40 Found the apartment the Professor mentioned. Yeah, looks like one of them used to live here. A few old appliances are still around. Swapped the battery - going to spend the night here. Just hope the circuit breaker holds and the door stays shut.
03.04.2012, 03:14 I woke up to a knock on the door. Saw three zombies through the crack in the door. They’re trying to break in. Hoping they’ll be gone by morning.
03.04.2012, 08:45 They’re still out there... I can smell them. Damn it. I’ll try to slip out.
03.04.2012, 12:31 Yeah, today went to hell. One of those rotting bastards bit through my jacket. The wound’s foaming white. This is bad.
03.04.2012, 16:05 PDA’s dead. Should’ve bought that spare battery from the Barkeep…
03.04.2012, 20:15 It’s getting dark. Just that damned red light... and the howling of zombies. The wound’s worse—covered in sores now. Why the hell did I come here?
04/04/2012, 03:55 The door won’t budge. They’re still out there. Just... standing. Waiting.
04.04.2012, 05:45 A couple of stalkers passed by. They didn’t hear me. Didn’t see me. I was shouting...

Brain Simulator
A device that simulates the psionic profile of a zombie, protecting its wearer from strong levels of psionic radiation that come from creatures that harness it as a weapon.
Decoy Device
A device that can be used to lure out the Sapient Swamp. To activate it, you must place the device in the desired area.
Sarcophagus research document
Ammo for Ferret
A box of ammunition that you need to give to Ferret.
Ferret's backpack
A heavy backpack filled with what are presumably artifacts. You can see an orange glow coming through the fabric.
Black box
A black box. Its contents are unknown.
Dead Stalker's Diary

An old, tattered diary found in the cab of a rusted, radioactive diesel locomotive - somehow located far from any known railway. Inside the cab were the decayed remains of what appeared to be the diary’s author. Judging by the entries, he had taken refuge there, trying to escape the horrors of the Zone.\n"...The voices are still swirling in my skull. They won’t leave. They beg me to look out the window, to see what’s left. But there’s nothing out there. Nothing. I silence them, because if I look, I’ll lose my mind. It’s empty - no color, no space. And who could survive after seeing that kind of emptiness? No one. There’s only a room inside me now, and I am that room. Beyond it - nothing. Just... nothing. Sometimes I hear something creaking, something growling on the other side. But it’s all just a voice. A voice from within. There’s nothing outside. I crawl around the room to avoid seeing the void - God forbid I look. My body hurts. My head too. The Geiger counter wouldn’t stop screaming. I threw it into the void, just to make it stop..."
Documentation about the installation at Lake Yantar

Documents recovered from the underground complex beneath Lake Yantar detail the early stages of a project focused on developing an artificially grown biological psi-emitter. The opening pages are filled with records of incoming biological material - primarily stray dogs left behind in Pripyat after the evacuation and wolves that had proliferated in the Chernobyl forests. However, some entries suggest that even then, researchers doubted the long-term viability of these sources and were already seeking new sources of biomaterial. Attached is a group photograph of the complex staff standing beside a life support unit sustaining the severed head of a dog; several of the scientists’ faces have been censored. The final pages include a roster of the first six-month research team, along with a comprehensive set of management-issued instructions for their assignment.
Pilot's PDA

A PDA recovered near the Agroprom Institute, apparently belonging to the pilot of a downed military helicopter. Before the crash - caused by an encounter with an anomaly - the helicopter had been conducting reconnaissance over the Cordon, Garbage, Dark Valley, and the surrounding areas of the Agroprom Institute. The PDA contains markings of numerous major sites in the southern Zone. Fortunately, this data never reached Perimeter Command and likely never will, meaning there’s little risk of them pushing deeper into the Zone for now. You can try transferring the pilot’s map markers to your own PDA - this information could prove valuable.
Monolith stalker diary

We are still far from HIS black, blinding radiance. His call reaches us - but not as strongly as it does in the North, in HIS domain. We’ve taken shelter in a basement and try to avoid going outside whenever possible. My brothers say that in this city, you must never set foot in the main square - the infidels have lined the rooftops with their arrows. One day, the mighty fist of the Monolith will reach this place and deliver us a triumphant victory. Until then, we must hold and await reinforcements. The second group should arrive soon, enough to bolster our presence in this sector. Just five minutes ago, Big Brother warned me that we’ll soon descend into the city’s sewer tunnels, from where we can strike at the heretics holed up in the Cooptorg building. But first, we’ll need to deal with the cannibal rats infesting the sewers.
Correspondence

Personal - to the head of strict regime facility 1269-bis, Pakhlo K.P.
Kirill Petrovich, once again I am reaching out with a request. I’m interested in a particular individual from your facility - designation: 115, V.D. Krivashin. I would like to receive his dossier as soon as possible, and preferably his full file as well. We are prepared to offer slightly more for this subject than the standard rate for an individual prisoner, though payment will be made only after receiving the copy. As before, we will handle transportation - your personnel at the checkpoint are already starting to ask questions.

Prof. V. M. Chubko

I have no idea where you got access to our prisoner lists, and frankly, I don’t want to know. I can’t attach the file from the archive - there’s an inspection scheduled in the coming days - so I’ll summarize the key details here: Viktor Davidovich Krivashin, born 1968. Organizer and chief ideologist of the religious cult known as the "Gray Brothers." The group was involved in sectarian activity, with documented cases of robbery resulting in fatalities, and instances of cannibalism among its members. Incarcerated since 1996, serving a life sentence. Krivashin is currently undergoing psychotherapy, but our psychologists' prognosis is bleak. I’ll do my best to send the subject your way as soon as possible.

Sincerely - head of strict regime facility 1269-bis, K.P. Pakhlo

P.S. Allow me to add the following: the dossier contains almost no information about Krivashin’s past. However, through my own sources, I discovered that before founding his religious organization, he worked at an institute focused on issues of self-governance. It’s likely that after the collapse of the USSR, the institute was shut down and the staff’s records were “sanitized.” But of course, I don’t need to be the one explaining that to you.

P.S. 2. The higher-ups are still trying to bury the story about that march of the "brothers" in the capital - doing everything they can to make sure no one remembers it. I assume you haven’t forgotten that incident...
Excerpt from the Kiev Division of Laboratory No. 15

Excerpt from the minutes of the 42nd meeting of the management team, Kiev Branch, Laboratory No. 15 - dated 09.09.96
Present:
